dt: {bc}to make free from injury or disease {bc}to make sound or whole
{bc}to cause (an undesirable condition) to be overcome {bc}{sx|mend||}

dt.t: the troubles … had not been forgotten, but they had been {wi}healed{/wi}

dt: {bc}to patch up or correct (a breach or division)
{bc}to restore to original purity or integrity
{bc}to become free from injury or disease {bc}to return to a sound state

et: Middle English {it}helen{/it}, from Old English {it}hǣlan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}heilen{/it} to heal, Old English {it}hāl{/it} whole {ma}{mat|whole|}{/ma}
shortdef: to make free from injury or disease : to make sound or whole
to make well again : to restore to health
to cause (an undesirable condition) to be overcome : mend

dt: used to say that feelings of sadness, disappointment, etc., gradually go away as time passes

dt.t: I thought I would never be able to love again, but, as they say, {it}time heals all wounds{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that feelings of sadness, disappointment, etc., gradually go away as time passes

dt: {bc}a blue-flowered Eurasian mint ({it}Prunella vulgaris{/it}) that is naturalized throughout North America and is held to have medicinal properties useful in herbal medicine

shortdef: a blue-flowered Eurasian mint (Prunella vulgaris) that is naturalized throughout North America and is held to have medicinal properties useful in herbal medicine
